intro: Eremogone cephalotes, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Eremogone cephalotes thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
